general.name: General Code Generator
general.description: General purpose code generation for any programming task. Used as fallback when no specialized tool matches.

seo_optimizer.name: SEO Optimizer
seo_optimizer.description: Optimizes technical content for search engines, suggests keywords, meta descriptions, and structure improvements

code_explainer.name: Code Concept Explainer
code_explainer.description: Explains complex programming concepts in simple terms for blog articles and tutorials. Creates analogies and examples.

outline_generator.name: Article Outline Generator
outline_generator.description: Creates detailed outlines for technical articles based on topics. Structures content logically.

mypy_type_checker.name: MyPy Type Checker
mypy_type_checker.description: Runs mypy type checking on Python code to find type errors before runtime

flake8_linter.name: Flake8 Style Checker
flake8_linter.description: Runs flake8 to check Python code style (PEP 8) and detect common errors

black_formatter.name: Black Code Formatter
black_formatter.description: Runs black formatter to check if Python code follows black style (with --check flag)

bandit_security.name: Bandit Security Scanner
bandit_security.description: Runs bandit security scanner to find common security issues in Python code

pytest_runner.name: Pytest Test Runner
pytest_runner.description: Runs pytest unit tests with coverage reporting

pytest_coverage.name: Pytest with Coverage
pytest_coverage.description: Runs pytest with code coverage analysis

radon_complexity.name: Radon Complexity Analyzer
radon_complexity.description: Analyzes code complexity metrics (cyclomatic complexity, maintainability index)

vulture_deadcode.name: Vulture Dead Code Finder
vulture_deadcode.description: Finds unused code (dead code) in Python projects

pydocstyle_checker.name: Pydocstyle Docstring Checker
pydocstyle_checker.description: Checks docstring style and completeness according to PEP 257

isort_import_checker.name: Isort Import Checker
isort_import_checker.description: Checks if Python imports are sorted correctly

quick_feedback.name: Quick Feedback Checker
quick_feedback.description: Fast spellcheck, grammar, and syntax error checker using tinyllama (2048 token context). Automatically chunks large text into logical segments. Gives quick feedback on generated text/code so generators can fix issues rapidly.

metadata.prompt_template:
Quick check this text for errors:

{text}

Find:
- Spelling errors
- Grammar mistakes  
- Syntax issues
- Structure problems

Provide a brief list of issues found (keep under 400 tokens). If no major issues, just say 'OK'. NOTE: You may be seeing a chunk of larger text - just check this portion.

summarizer.name: Content Summarizer
summarizer.description: Summarizes long content, code, documentation, or conversations using Gemma2:2b model with 8192 token context window. Efficient for condensing information.

metadata.prompt_template:
Summarize the following content:

{content}

Summary requirements:
- Capture all key points
- Be concise but complete
- Prioritize most important information
- Target length: {target_length}

Provide a well-structured summary.

nmt_translator.name: NMT Translation Service
nmt_translator.description: Neural Machine Translation service for translating text between languages. VERY FAST but can be inaccurate - MUST validate output with translation_quality_checker for repeated characters and garbled text. Uses OpenAPI spec from http://localhost:8000/openapi.json.

metadata.capabilities:
API: NMT Translation Service
Base URL: http://localhost:8000

Available Operations (18):

- root_redirect__get:
  Method: GET /
  Summary: Root Redirect
  Description: Redirects to the interactive demo UI

- healthz_healthz_get:
  Method: GET /healthz
  Summary: Health Check
  Description: Returns health status

- readyz_readyz_get:
  Method: GET /readyz
  Summary: Readiness Check
  Description: Returns readiness status with device and queue info

- cache_status_cache_get:
  Method: GET /cache
  Summary: Cache Status
  Description: Returns the currently cached translation pipelines and queue info

- model_name_model_name_get:
  Method: GET /model_name
  Summary: Model Name
  Description: Returns the name of the loaded model and configuration snapshot

- discover_opus_mt_discover_opus_mt_get:
  Method: GET /discover/opus-mt
  Summary: Discover Opus-MT Pairs
  Description: Discovers all available Opus-MT language pairs from Hugging Face. Results are cached for 1 hour.
  Parameters: force_refresh (query)

- discover_mbart50_discover_mbart50_get:
  Method: GET /discover/mbart50
  Summary: Discover mBART50 Pairs
  Description: Returns all available mBART50 language pairs (all-to-all for 50 languages).

- discover_m2m100_discover_m2m100_get:
  Method: GET /discover/m2m100
  Summary: Discover M2M100 Pairs
  Description: Returns all available M2M100 language pairs (all-to-all for 100 languages).

- discover_all_discover_all_get:
  Method: GET /discover/all
  Summary: Discover All Models
  Description: Discovers all available language pairs for all model families.
  Parameters: force_refresh (query)

- clear_discovery_cache_discover_clear_cache_post:
  Method: POST /discover/clear-cache
  Summary: Clear Discovery Cache
  Description: Clears the model discovery cache. Next discovery request will fetch fresh data.

- lang_pairs_lang_pairs_get:
  Method: GET /lang_pairs
  Summary: Lang Pairs
  Description: Returns the language pairs from the model
:return:

- get_languages_get_languages_get:
  Method: GET /get_languages
  Summary: Get Languages
  Description: Returns the languages the model supports
:param source_lang: Optional. Only return languages with this language as source
:param target_lang: Optional. Only return languages with this language as target
:return:
  Parameters: source_lang (query), target_lang (query)

- compat_translate_get_endpoint_compat_translate_get:
  Method: GET /compat/translate
  Summary: EasyNMT GET /translate (compat)
  Parameters: target_lang (query) (required), text (query), source_lang (query), beam_size (query), perform_sentence_splitting (query)

- compat_translate_post_endpoint_compat_translate_post:
  Method: POST /compat/translate
  Summary: EasyNMT POST /translate (compat)

- translate_get_endpoint_translate_get:
  Method: GET /translate
  Summary: Translate
  Description: Translates the text to the given target language.
:param text: Text that should be translated
:param target_lang: Target language
:param source_lang: Language of text. Optional, if empty: Automatic language detection
:param beam_size: Beam size. Optional
:param perform_sentence_splitting: Split longer documents into individual sentences for translation. Optional
:return: Returns a json with the translated text
  Parameters: target_lang (query) (required), text (query), source_lang (query), beam_size (query), perform_sentence_splitting (query)

- translate_post_endpoint_translate_post:
  Method: POST /translate
  Summary: Translate Post
  Description: Post method for translation
:return:

- language_detection_get_endpoint_language_detection_get:
  Method: GET /language_detection
  Summary: Language Detection
  Description: Detects the language for the provided text
:param text: A single text for which we want to know the language
:return: The detected language
  Parameters: text (query) (required)

- language_detection_post_endpoint_language_detection_post:
  Method: POST /language_detection
  Summary: Language Detection Post
  Description: Pass a json that has a 'text' key. The 'text' element can either be a string, a list of strings, or
a dict.
:return: Languages detected
metadata.code_template:
# Example: How to use the NMT Translation Service
import requests
import json

def translate_text(text, source_lang="en", target_lang="es"):
    """
    Translate text using the NMT service.

    Args:
        text: Text to translate
        source_lang: Source language code (e.g., 'en', 'es', 'fr')
        target_lang: Target language code

    Returns:
        Translated text
    """
    url = "http://localhost:8000/translate"

    payload = {
        "text": text,
        "source_lang": source_lang,
        "target_lang": target_lang
    }

    response = requests.post(url, json=payload)
    response.raise_for_status()

    result = response.json()
    return result.get("translated_text", "")

# Usage example:
# translated = translate_text("Hello, world!", source_lang="en", target_lang="es")
# print(translated)  # Output: "Hola, mundo!"

translation_quality_checker.name: Translation Quality Validator
translation_quality_checker.description: Fast quality check for translation output using tinyllama. Detects repeated characters, garbled text, encoding errors, and translation failures. MUST be used after nmt_translator to validate output quality.

metadata.prompt_template:
Validate this translated text for quality issues:

Original: {original_text}
Translated: {translated_text}

Check for:
1. Repeated characters (e.g., 'aaaa', '||||')
2. Garbled text (random symbols, encoding errors)
3. Untranslated portions
4. Missing or corrupted text
5. Obvious translation failures

Respond with ONLY:
- 'OK' if translation looks good
- 'ERROR: <brief description>' if issues found

Keep response under 100 tokens.

add_100_and_200.name: Python function to add two numbers with JSON input/output

long_form_writer.name: Long-Form Content Writer
long_form_writer.description: Specialized for writing long-form content (novels, books, long articles) using mistral-nemo's massive 128K context window. Best for creative writing, story generation, and content that requires maintaining continuity over many pages. Use with summarizer for ultra-long content.

write_me_code_to_do_a_fibonacc.name: Python implementation to generate Fibonacci sequence
write_me_code_to_do_a_fibonacc.description: write me code to do a fibonacci sequanece

code_translation_validator.name: Code Translation Validator
code_translation_validator.description: Fast validator that ensures translation hasn't corrupted Python code blocks. Checks that code syntax remains valid, only comments are translated, and no code keywords were mistranslated. Use AFTER translating documents containing code.

metadata.prompt_template:
Validate this translated code:

{translated_code}

Check:
1. Python syntax is still valid
2. Only comments were translated (not keywords, variables, functions)
3. Code structure is unchanged
4. No code keywords mistranslated (def, class, import, if, for, etc.)

Respond with:
- 'OK' if code is valid
- 'ERROR: <list of issues>' if problems found

Be concise (under 100 tokens).

fast_code_generator.name: Fast Code Generator
fast_code_generator.description: Fast code generation for simple tasks using tinyllama. Best for basic arithmetic, simple functions, straightforward algorithms. NOT suitable for complex logic, multi-step workflows, or sophisticated algorithms.

metadata.prompt_template:
Generate Python code for this SIMPLE task:

{task}

Requirements:
- Keep code simple and concise (you have limited context)
- Focus on correctness over sophistication
- Basic error handling only
- Must work for the specific task

Generate only the essential code needed.

save_to_disk.name: Save to Disk
save_to_disk.description: Saves content to a file in the ./output/ directory (for safety). Use for saving stories, specifications, code, documentation, or any generated content. CRITICAL: Only saves to ./output/ directory to prevent accidental overwrites.

args: import sys, json, pathlib; data=json.load(sys.stdin); path=pathlib.Path('output')/data['filename']; path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True); path.write_text(data['content']); print(json.dumps({'status': 'saved', 'path': str(path)}))

load_from_disk.name: Load from Disk
load_from_disk.description: Loads content from any file path on disk. Use for reading specifications, code, documentation, or configuration files. Can read from anywhere on the filesystem (not restricted to ./output/). Useful for self-optimization tasks where the system reads its own code.

args: import sys, json, pathlib; data=json.load(sys.stdin); path=pathlib.Path(data['filepath']); content=path.read_text() if path.exists() else None; print(json.dumps({'status': 'loaded' if content else 'not_found', 'content': content, 'path': str(path)}))
